title: Knee Pain Decision Support
description: Understand your knee pain and explore evidence-based treatment options.
welcome_message: Welcome! Let's talk about your knee pain and what options might work best for you.
system_prompt_template: You are a healthcare assistant helping a patient with knee pain. The patient has: Duration: {duration}, Pain severity: {pain_severity}, Affected knee: {affected_knee}, Activity level: {activity_level}. Provide evidence-based guidance on treatment options.

onboarding_questions.text: How long have you had knee pain?
How severe is your knee pain?

options.title: Physical Therapy
options.description: A structured program of exercises to strengthen muscles around the knee, improve flexibility, and reduce pain.
benefits: Can delay or prevent need for surgery
drawbacks: May require multiple sessions per week
Success depends on adherence to home exercises

options.title: Knee Injections
options.description: Injections into the knee joint, including corticosteroids for inflammation or hyaluronic acid for lubrication.
benefits: May enable participation in physical therapy
Multiple types available for different needs
drawbacks: Relief is typically temporary (weeks to months)
Limited number of steroid injections per year
options.typical_timeline: Relief within days, lasting weeks to months

options.title: Medication Management
options.description: Using anti-inflammatory medications, pain relievers, or topical treatments to manage knee pain.
benefits: Can be combined with other treatments
drawbacks: Potential side effects with long-term use
Some medications interact with other drugs

options.title: Knee Arthroscopy
options.description: Minimally invasive surgery using small incisions and a camera to repair or remove damaged tissue.
benefits: Can repair specific issues (meniscus tears, loose bodies)
drawbacks: May not provide lasting relief for some conditions

options.title: Knee Replacement Surgery
options.description: Surgical replacement of damaged knee joint surfaces with artificial components.
benefits: High success rate for appropriate candidates
drawbacks: Major surgery with significant recovery (3-6 months)
Some activities may be limited after surgery

options.title: Lifestyle Modifications
options.description: Changes to daily activities, weight management, and use of supportive devices like braces.
benefits: Weight loss significantly reduces knee stress
Braces can provide stability and support
drawbacks: May not be sufficient for severe conditions
Weight loss takes time and effort
options.success_rate: Weight loss of 10% can reduce pain by 50%
